results.title: Jamie, Ethan and Marlon: the first two months
results.creator_credit: Robert Humble, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Child”.
He has just made his debut into the world. How does he shape up? In this first film, a pediatrician explains what he looks for when he gives a newborn infant his first physical checkup—testing reflexes, muscle tone, eye movement, etc. Three babies are observed, first in hospital, then at home in the care of their parents.

results.title: If we don't go, we'll never know, will we?
results.creator_credit: Russell Toose, Constance Bernstein and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
The Gordons, with their four children, are migrating from England to australia. This film interviews the Gordons in England and hears of their hopes and dreams. It then spends the first six months in Australia with the family to find out the reality. Reporters: Richard Oxenburgh, Robert Higson.

group_siblings.title: My brown skin baby, they take 'im away

results.title: It's easier in the country
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chequerboard”.
One of a series of films which looks at the lives of children growing up in different environments. Investigates the idea that the country is the best place to rear children by looking at the lives of two boys from different country backgrounds.

results.title: Acids, bases and salts. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur and Coronet Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Differing in their reaction with indicators, acids can be defined as proton acceptors using the Bronsted-Lowry theory. The Lewis theory is also explained, as well as the meaning of pH.

results.title: Solutions: ionic and molecular. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
Illustrates the chemical nature of a solution, what happens when it forms and the role of the electrostatic forces. Shows Brownian movement, defines saturation and presents the concept of molarity along with an explanation of why some substances, eg oil, won’t dissolve in other substances such as water. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Chemical bonding and atomic structure. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Mel Waskin, Roger Mazur, Coronet Films and Don Lane Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chemistry”.
The substances forming our world are composed of atoms held together by powerful electrical forces called chemical bonds. The physical and chemical properties of elements and compounds depend on the nature of these bonds. Discusses metallic, ionic, covalent and interatomic bonds and forces dealing with ions, atoms, crystals, valence, polarity and Van der Waals forces. Suitable for upper secondary level.
